intro: Rhexia ventricosa, commonly known as the swamp pink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as bogs, marshes, and swampy areas. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Rhexia ventricosa is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants.
